summary: A dystopian society ruled by total surveillance and propaganda. Winston tries to preserve truth and inner freedom in the face of a regime that controls thought.

title: The Hobbit
summary: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected adventure alongside dwarves to recover a treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug. He discovers courage, friendship, and a stronger self.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
summary: A boy discovers he is a wizard and arrives at Hogwarts, where friendship and courage help him face the first dangers of the magical world.

title: Pride and Prejudice
summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates social conventions and class prejudice, learning about herself and love in her complicated relationship with Mr. Darcy.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
summary: In a small town in the American South, Scout witnesses racial injustice through the eyes of childhood while her father, a lawyer, defends a man wrongly accused.

title: The Great Gatsby
summary: Jay Gatsby pursues a dream of love and status in the glittering yet hollow world of the 1920s, where appearances hide disillusionment.

title: Moby-Dick
summary: Captain Ahab sets out on an obsessive hunt for a white whale. A meditation on fate, nature, and revenge at sea.

title: War and Peace
summary: The lives of numerous characters intertwine during the Napoleonic wars, amid love, loss, and questions about the meaning of history.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
summary: Holden Caulfield wanders through New York, grappling with alienation and the painful passage into adulthood.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
summary: A ring of power threatens the world. A fellowship sets out on a perilous quest to destroy it, testing loyalty and courage.
